marketNews.title: Car Wholesales August 2025 Still at 60s Level, Down -19% YoY
marketNews.content: Gaikindo reported that national car wholesales in August 2025 were recorded at only 61,780 units (-19% YoY, +1% MoM), marking the third consecutive month of annual car sales decline around -20% YoY. The realization of sales in August 2025 also confirms the weak GIIAS 2025, which was held from July 24 to August 3, 2025. During July and August 2025, the average monthly sales reached only 61,329 units, which is -17% lower compared to July 2024 sales of 74,230 units, when GIIAS 2024 was held from July 18-24, 2024. The sales figures for August 2025 bring national car wholesales for 8M25 to 500,952 units (-11% YoY), equivalent to 56-67% of Gaikindo's 2025 target range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 8M24: 65% realization for 2024).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway: Auto Sector Stock Movement Amidst Weak Sales
marketNews.content: Although the car sales trend remains weak, we assess that low market expectations mean that car sales realization no longer significantly affects the stock price movements of automotive issuers. As we mentioned previously, with low market expectations, stock prices will potentially also be influenced by other factors, such as the strategic review currently being undertaken by ASII. In the past 1 month, automotive stocks have actually increased in price, with ASII +13.3%, AUTO +5.5%, and DRMA +3.6%. Specifically for ASII, we assess that investors need to monitor the progress of the company's capital management plan - including its subsidiaries like UNTR and AUTO - considering that more optimal balance sheet utilization potentially provides further room for strengthening in stock prices, in our opinion.

marketNews.title: The Controller is Reported to Plan to Sell SGRO
marketNews.content: Other hot things you need to know...

marketNews.title: Rp200 Trillion Breakthrough by Pak Purba: New Signal for the Economy and IHSG
marketNews.content: "My suggestion is to involve the private sector so that the prices and quality of government-owned goods become more competitive instead of a monopoly." - michaeljamesbio

tickerNews.title: Sampoerna Family Reportedly Considering Sale of SGRO Stake
tickerNews.content: SGRO: Bloomberg reported on Wednesday (10/9) that the Sampoerna family is considering selling its 65.7% stake in Sampoerna Agro. Bloomberg sources mentioned that this transaction plan could reflect an SGRO valuation in the range of 500-700 million US dollars or 8.2-11.5 trillion rupiah. For comparison, SGRO's market cap stood at approximately 7.9 trillion rupiah as of Wednesday (10/9). Bloomberg sources stated that the Sampoerna family is working with financial advisors through Twinwood Family Holdings Ltd. to gauge interest from potential buyers. Deliberations regarding this plan are ongoing and may not result in any transaction, according to Bloomberg sources. Representatives for the Sampoerna family and SGRO have not yet responded to this news.

tickerNews.title: WIFI Discloses Progress on Link Net Acquisition Plan
tickerNews.content: WIFI: Shannedy Ong, Director of Solusi Sinergi Digital, stated that his party is currently in the bidding process to acquire shares in Link Net (LINK). However, Shannedy explained that they are bound by a non-disclosure agreement with the shareholders, so they cannot provide further details. Previously, DealStreetAsia reported in August 2025 that the Axiata group was entering the final stage to sell its majority stake in LINK with an estimated value of over 1 billion US dollars, potentially becoming one of the largest digital infrastructure transactions in Southeast Asia this year. Several DealStreetAsia sources mentioned that WIFI and I Squared Capital are the leading potential buyers.

tickerNews.title: BREN Affiliate Sells Shares to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: BREN: Barito Renewables Energy shareholder affiliated with the controller, Green Era Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 87.7 million BREN shares on September 3-9, 2025, at an average price of 8,416 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached approximately 737.9 billion rupiah and was conducted to increase the free float of shares circulating in the market. Following this transaction, Green Era's direct ownership decreased from approximately 22.08% to 22.02%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Plans to Operate Two New Hospitals by Year-End 2025 and Add 3 More in 2026
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Yulisar Khiat, Vice President Director of Medikaloka Hermina, stated that his party plans to add 3 hospitals in 2026, consisting of 2 new hospitals and the acquisition of 1 hospital. Currently, HEAL already operates 51 hospitals with a total of 8,287 beds. For expansion this year, the company estimates the construction of 2 new hospitals in Bali and Salatiga will be completed by the end of 2025. Bisnis reported that by 2030, HEAL plans to own a total of 65-70 hospitals with installed bed capacity reaching 12,000-15,000.

tickerNews.title: ITMG Opens Opportunity to Increase Cooperation or Ownership Portion in NICE
tickerNews.content: ITMG: Mulianto, President Director of Indo Tambangraya Megah, stated that his party is opening opportunities to increase cooperation or ownership portion in Adhi Kartiko Pratama (NICE). Previously, ITMG purchased a 9.62% stake in NICE at a price of 438 rupiah per share on July 4, 2025. Mulianto explained that ITMG's entry as an investor in NICE is the company's commitment to participate in the electrification trend through nickel development.

tickerNews.title: MIKA Prepares Seven Empty Lands for New Hospital Construction
tickerNews.content: MIKA: Aditya Widjaja, Head of Investor Relations Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat, stated that his party has 7 plots of land for hospital development. Of these plots, MIKA has started construction for 3 hospitals, including 1 hospital in Sidoarjo expected to operate in 3Q25 and 2 other locations expected to operate in 3Q26. The Capex allocation for these three hospitals reaches approximately 950 billion rupiah, in line with the 2025 Capex allocation plan. Meanwhile, the remaining 4 plots of land are planned to begin groundbreaking in 2026, with a target opening of 1-2 hospitals per year and an estimated Capex of 200 billion rupiah per hospital. The maximum capacity of these seven locations is 200 beds per location or a total of 1,400 beds (vs. capacity as of 1H25: 4,160 beds).

tickerNews.title: PTPP Records New Contracts Worth IDR 15.3 Trillion in 8M25
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP recorded new contract value of approximately 15.3 trillion rupiah during 8M25 (-19.8% YoY), equivalent to 53.6% of the 2025 target of 28.5 trillion rupiah. The new contract value was dominated by projects from SOEs at 51.2%, followed by private sector (31%) and government (17.8%).

tickerNews.title: BWPT Allocates Capex of IDR 1.66 Trillion for Expansion and Energy
tickerNews.content: BWPT: Choong Kam Loong, Director of Eagle High Plantations, stated that his party will allocate Capex of around 1.66 trillion rupiah in the 2025-2029 period, most of which will be allocated for increasing palm oil mill capacity, energy expansion, and heavy equipment rejuvenation. BWPT plans to add 2 palm oil mills (PKS) in East Kalimantan and 1 PKS in Papua, with a total additional production capacity of 180,000 tons per year. Bisnis reported that BWPT currently has a total plantation land area of 87,000 hectares and PKS capacity reaching 2.2 million tons per year.

tickerNews.title: Two EXCL Directors Purchase Shares to Increase Free Float
tickerNews.content: EXCL: Two directors of XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera, Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia and David Arcelus Oses, purchased 150,000 shares and approximately 1.6 million shares of EXCL, respectively, at an average price of 2,580 rupiah per share on September 9, 2025. The total transaction value for both reached approximately 4.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of Sanjay Kumar Gordhan A. Vaghasia in EXCL increased from 0.0008% to 0.0016%, while David Arcelus Oses' ownership increased from none to 0.0089%.

tickerNews.title: ARKO Subsidiary Signs 20 MW Hydropower PPA with PLN Subsidiary
tickerNews.content: ARKO: Arkora Hydro, through its subsidiary PT Nosu Hydro, signed a 20 MW Pongbembe Hydropower Plant (PLTA) power purchase agreement (PPA) for 30 years with PLN. The total contract value was not announced. The Pongbembe PLTA itself is a project developed by ARKO through a 150 billion rupiah loan from its parent company, United Tractors (UNTR), in mid-2024.

tickerNews.title: Finance Minister Opens Possibility to Revise 2026 Draft Budget Plans
tickerNews.content: Finance Minister, Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, stated on Wednesday (10/9) that his office is opening the possibility to revise the proposed 2026 State Budget Draft (RAPBN). Regarding this, Purbaya claimed to have agreed with Commission XI of the DPR to increase the regional transfer budget in 2026, contrary to the 2026 RAPBN proposal which projected regional transfers to decrease by about -25% YoY. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto conveyed the 2026 RAPBN proposed by Sri Mulyani to the DPR in August 2025, with a deficit projection of 2.48% of GDP and an assumption of state revenue increase of about +10% YoY. The DPR usually requires up until early October to approve the following year's RAPBN.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia Relies on Palm Oil to Reduce US Import Tariffs
tickerNews.content: The Indonesian Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to the United States, Dwisuryo Indroyono Soesilo, stated that Indonesian negotiators will strive for lower US tariffs on palm oil, nickel, copper, and other goods during negotiations in Washington, US in September 2025. The government is also reportedly pushing for lower tariffs on shrimp, wood, and furniture commodities.

tickerNews.title: Consumer Confidence Index Drops to Lowest Level Since September 2022
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that the Indonesian consumer confidence index dropped to 117.2 in August 2025 (vs. July 2025: 118.1, August 2024: 124.4), marking the lowest level since September 2022. This result was driven by declines in almost all sub-indices, except for the income expectation index and the business activity expectation index. The sub-indices experiencing the deepest declines were the employment availability index and the employment availability expectation index, which fell by -2.1 points and -2.2 points, respectively.

tickerNews.title: Bank Indonesia Projects Retail Sales Growth of +2.7% YoY for August 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia projects retail sales in August 2025 will grow by +2.7% YoY, although it is projected to contract by -0.3% MoM. In July 2025, retail sales were recorded to grow by +4.7% YoY, despite contracting by -4.1% MoM aligning with the end of the holiday and collective leave period (vs. June 2025: +1.3% YoY, -0.2% MoM), lower than Bank Indonesia's expectation of +4.8% YoY growth and -4% MoM contraction.

tickerNews.title: Electric Motorcycle Incentives to Continue as Part of Q3 2025 Economic Stimulus Package
tickerNews.content: Susiwijono Moegiarso, Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, stated that incentives for purchasing electric motorcycles will continue by being combined into the economic stimulus package for the 3Q25 period. Previously, the Ministry of Finance in August 2025 mentioned preparing a stimulus worth 10.8 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 to maintain national economic growth momentum. Susiwijono also mentioned that the Coordinating Minister for the Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, is preparing several programs for 2026. Furthermore, the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs is studying various aspects regarding incentives, including technical certainty, the amount of incentives, implementation time, and new mechanisms to make them more easily accessible to the public.

tickerNews.title: Government Plans to Set Waste-to-Energy Electricity Selling Price at 20 US Cents/kWh
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that the government plans to set the selling price of electricity generated from waste-to-energy power plants (PLTSa) to PLN at 20 US cents per kWh, an increase from the previous regulation's upper limit of 13.35 US cents per kWh. Yuliot Tanjung, Vice Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, stated that this increase in PLTSa electricity tariffs is due to the removal of the tipping fee scheme - a fee paid by regional governments to PLTSa operators for every ton of waste processed - in the draft revision of Presidential Regulation (Perpres) Number 35 of 2018. Yuliot added that the revision of this Perpres will be completed this month.

tickerNews.title: Pertamina Plans to Merge Refinery, Shipping, and Retail Operations by End of 2025
tickerNews.content: Pertamina President Director, Simon Aloysius Mantiri, stated on Thursday (11/9) that his party plans to merge the operations of the refinery, shipping, and retail business units to improve core business efficiency. This integration is expected to be completed by the end of 2025. Simon added that Pertamina's non-core businesses will be integrated with similar SOEs, and his party has held discussions with Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) to merge Pelita Air airline with Garuda.

tickerNews.title: Futura Energi Global (FUTR) Announces Completion of Major Share Purchase by Aurora Dhana Nusantara
tickerNews.content: Futura Energi Global (FUTR) announced that PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara has completed the purchase of approximately 3 billion (45%) FUTR shares at a price of 11 rupiah per share, totaling approximately 32.8 billion rupiah. Previously, FUTR announced that PT Aurora Dhana Nusantara had signed a term sheet for the planned acquisition of approximately 3.3 billion (49.325%) FUTR shares from the existing controller, PT Digital Futurama Global.

tickerNews.title: Green Power Group (LABA) Increases Stake in KRYA via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: Green Power Group (LABA) purchased approximately 282.9 million (17%) shares of Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya (KRYA) at an average price of 33 rupiah per share on September 10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 9.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, LABA's ownership in KRYA increased from none to 17%. Previously, KRYA announced that LABA was one of the potential buyers of KRYA shares, along with Rich Step International Ltd., PT EVMOTO Teknologi Indonesia, PT Huashang Investment Group, and PT Cahaya Intan Niaga.

tickerNews.title: Sidomulyo Selaras (SDMU) Plans Private Placement to Convert Debt
tickerNews.content: Sidomulyo Selaras (SDMU) announced plans for a private placement of approximately 1.12 billion new shares with a dilution effect of 49.56% and an exercise price of 55 rupiah per share. This corporate action is intended to convert debt amounting to approximately 61.4 billion rupiah owed to Tjoe Mien Sasminto. This plan will be discussed in an Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on October 17, 2025.
